_header: To Thee O merciful saviour mine Jesu
_description: William Dunbar, ‘The tabill of confessioun’ — 19 stanzas, usually of 8 lines, ababbcbc, two of 10 lines, abababbcbc, with refrain, ‘I cry the mercy and lasar to repent’

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
To the o mercifull saluitour myn IesusMy king my lord and my
                    redeymar sweit…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
… And sauf me Iesu for thy woundis fyveThat cryis the mercy
                    and lasar to repent
CamMagPep2553.Attributed Title:
heir endis ane confessioun generale compylit be maister williame dunbar (p.
                    203)
CamMagPep2553.Editions:
Craigie,  William Alexander. 
             The Maitland Folio Manuscript, Containing Poems by Sir Richard
                Maitland, Dunbar, Douglas, Henryson, and others.
             2 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society
         n.s. 7 (1919), 20 (1927); Edinburgh and London: Blackwood, 1919,
            1927: 1.224-9.

BLAru285.First Lines: TO THE O MARcifull saluiour myn IhesusMy kyng my lord & my redemer sueit…
BLAru285.Last Lines: …And saist me Ihesu for thy woundis fiveI cry ye marcy and I Laser to repent
BLAru285.Attributed Title: The tabill off confessioun (RT); Heir endis the tabill of confessioun compilit be M. William Dunber (f. 4v)

Banna.First Lines:
To the O mercifull salviour IesusMy King My lord and my redemare
                    sweit…
Banna.Last Lines:
…And saif me Iesu for thy woundis fyveThat cryis the mercy and
                    lasar to repent
